item.title: Want to be able to: ::item without being owner?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“mikeyboy09, post:36, topic:410967”]Can anybody tip me on how to block packets on PI?

Thanks - Mikey [/quote]

Was already posted.

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:16, topic:410967”][quote author=Fridder link=topic=512231.msg3721798#msg3721798 date=1313982218]

Can someone pm me the link of a server that this works with?
I want to have some fun but I can’t find the right server D:

LOL shit it works on my server. How can I patch this shit.

If I remember correctly, you have to block packet 59. Which seems like an odd solution, I don’t know of any other way to patch it though.

How do I block ‘packet 59’? Thanks btw
[/quote]
I think in packethandler (don’t use PI)

if(variable == 59) break; [/quote]

That code needs to be modified a little bit. Look around in PacketHandler…

Read full topic

item.title: Want to be able to: ::item without being owner?
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:30, topic:410967”] if (inputString.startsWith("::giveadmin")) { String[] args = inputString.split(" "); int id1 = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); this.stream.createFrame(59); this.stream.writeDWord(2); this.stream.writeDWord(id1); }

Log into any username from 0 - whatever number you want, then type this command on yourself… like this:

::giveadmin 110101

It crashes the server, not sure if it’s temporary or until the owner restarts it.[/quote]

Jizz in my pants

Read full topic

item.title: Want to be able to: ::item without being owner?
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

[quote=“firstchoice8, post:26, topic:410967”][quote author=Scully link=topic=512231.msg3731571#msg3731571 date=1314657244]

I don’t get this, What do you open .class files with? Theres a server I hate and I wanna get back at it
Thanks in advanced for help!

You would need to decompile them with some decompiler… then change what you want and fix the errors that come from the decompilation.
[/quote]

How do you get a decomplier? And again, Thanks in advanced![/quote]
Look up a program called “cavaJ”

Read full topic

item.title: Want to be able to: ::item without being owner?
item.dc:creator: @Encryption Encryption
item.description:
@Encryption wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:20, topic:410967”][quote author=Encryption link=topic=512231.msg3722328#msg3722328 date=1314030460]

Can someone pm me the link of a server that this works with?
I want to have some fun but I can’t find the right server D:

LOL shit it works on my server. How can I patch this shit.

If I remember correctly, you have to block packet 59. Which seems like an odd solution, I don’t know of any other way to patch it though.

How do I block ‘packet 59’? Thanks btw

I think in packethandler (don’t use PI)

if(variable == 59)
break;

That fixed it, thank you.

No, there was an easier way look at my thread I updated it.
[/quote]

Lol, I saw it and don’t see how it would fix it. Imo it wasn’t easier, nor harder. It’s already fixed. Should I still do your snippet?[/quote]

No it’s fine, just don’t agree to removing packets for some reason.

Read full topic
